column4: Having problems with my built in soundcard. When inserting headphones, the speakers wont mute. Im using "snd-hda-intel" and ACL888 (laptop LG X110)
what motherboard?
how can i see that?
try: sudo dmidecode | less
how about we try another way?
sudo dmidecode > /tmp/dmi-info
then open that file (/tmp/dmi-info) in a text editor and copy it into http://paste.ubuntu.com
fine, ill post it wait
forget what I just said, do what Seveas suggested :)
http://paste.ubuntu.com/781455/
you have an LG X110-G.A7HBV
10.2in screen netbook?
do you mean a flag to the module in alsa_base.conf?
yes. see https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HdaIntelSoundHowto
i looked at that earlier today
anything particularly interesting?
look at the list of HD-Audio model IDs for the ALC888, and try them all in turn is really all I can suggest :(
what about the jack configuration?
that's what i was talking about -- card model ('model' parameter to the module) is the jack configuration
ah i see. how about the enable=1 flag?
no, you can do 'rmmod snd-intel-hda; modprobe snd-intel-hda model=xyz'
count to ten after you do that, it'll take a minute for PulseAudio to restart
